Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses feelings of anger and sadness related to her ex-husband, indicating difficulty in letting go of these emotions.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient continues to struggle with anger towards her ex-husband and has identified triggers for her irritability, primarily linked to thoughts of him and fatigue.
Psychosocial History: The patient finds joy in spending time with her son and has had positive social interactions, which help alleviate her feelings of sadness.
Mental Health Observations: The patient reports feeling calmer after practicing mindfulness and feels lighter after social interactions.
Physiological Observations: The patient reports ongoing sleep disturbances, waking frequently at night.
Progress Evaluation: The patient is making efforts to cope with her emotions and is open to exploring new strategies.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to practice mindfulness and establish a calming bedtime routine to improve her emotional and sleep health.
Next Steps: The patient plans to incorporate mindfulness into her morning routine, establish a calming bedtime routine, and reach out to friends for social support.
